fields.summary: BE - When account is COD or PS-Cash pull in the card on file and make that as the default

comments.body:
Hello [~11138670] , Here is the MR [https://gitlab.autozone.com/commercial/b2b/azpro/-/merge_requests/4808] to fix the issue ,

Below logic has been implemented - 

1. If AZCharge available then use that as preferred payment methods (this takes the priority )
2 if AZCharge not available but CC are available and the CC is preferred then that CC will be available as preferred payment method.
3. Or else , In rest of the case Cash will be default preferred method
Hello [~30081459] , This can be verified against https://track.autozone.com/browse/EOCO-2730 which is available in qa1 now.

Validated in QA1 Env,

It's working as expected, So moved to PO Approval

Validated below scenarios,
 # TC01_Validate the preferred flag is true for one credit card, which is the primary payment method, when the customer credit type as COD and have credit card payments
 # TC02_Validate the preferred flag is true for COD, when the customer credit type as COD and don't have the credit card
 # TC03_Validate the preferred flag is true for AZ Charge, when the customer credit type as Non-Cash and have credit card payments
 # TC04_Validate the preferred flag is true for AZ Charge, when the customer credit type as Non-Cash and don't have credit card

PFA, [^EOCO-2730 (qa1) - Tested - 28.05.2024.docx]

 

CC : [~30081459] , [~asander1] , [~11165695] , [~11222415]

Verified in Stage env and its working as expected.

Validated below scenarios,
 # TC01_Validate the preferred flag is true for one credit card, which is the primary payment method, when the customer credit type as COD and have credit card payments
 # TC02_Validate the preferred flag is true for COD, when the customer credit type as COD and don't have the credit card
 # TC03_Validate the preferred flag is true for AZ Charge, when the customer credit type as Non-Cash and have credit card payments

fields.summary: Transfer & Transfer/Purchase Cart UI Issues

comments.body: *Jira Automation*: This story was >almost< added to the active sprint, but only Alecia is allowed to move stories into the active sprint. (cc [~30081459], [~11176407], [~asander1])

*Dev Comments:*

*1. Name your quote should be removed*
Name your quote text filed visibility is dynamically change based on the rules table in the ticket [https://track.autozone.com/browse/EOCO-2524]

for some users it is available.

*2. Deal qualified message is displaying by default for all items*
Message visibility depends on the property *punchoutDealEnabled* coming from cart API
if it TRUE, will show the Deal qualified message.

*3. Do we need to show "Pickup or Delivery" text even if we are defaulting all users to have delivery as delivery request*
Developed based on Figma  [https://www.figma.com/design/O4SqypcHFyuag0Vx3g6stS/E0M-18-Cart-%2F-Checkout?node-id=6268-198022&t=fWVs7zTYUDd3Ahl2-0]

*4. The button "TRANSFER" in current stage termed as "TRANSFER CART". Do we need to change this?*
Developed based on Figma

*5. Hide cost link is not same as in figma*
Waiting for POs feedback

*6. Name quote is visible for transfer and purchase option as well and Notes are not displaying in expected position (It should come under po number field as in figma)*

Name your quote text filed visibility is dynamically change based on the rules table in the ticket [https://track.autozone.com/browse/EOCO-2524]

Please login with the user which have not quote enabled. Then you will see the exact UI as in the Figma.

Thank you

fields.summary: CARVANA - Modify OrderApprovalService to get the vehicle details from VIN

comments.body: MR for the change : [https://gitlab.autozone.com/commercial/b2b/azpro/-/merge_requests/4777/]

Testing steps:
 # For the Vin passed in the cxml get the AzvehicleId.
 # query for the az vehicle id in vehicleRepository and pin and check if there are any items returned. If there items returned delete the item.

queris:

<query-items item-descriptor="vehicle" id-only="false">
pin = "100002" AND azVehicleId = "4081401"
</query-items>

<remove-item id="233000001-md2" item-descriptor="vehicle" />

3. Once the vehicleItem repository is not there for azVehicleId and pin submit order with the cxml

4. Once the order is submitted and processed check the vehicleRepository . Item should be created

[~11155926] What if we need to add items to 2 different vehicles? If we are not allowing 2 different vehicles, then whats the purpose of passing vehicle info at item level. Could you please confirm on this.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Could you please share vehicleRepository link?

CC: [~11222415] [~10672880]

[~30081459] Since this cXml is genrated at Caravana and they will not have the azVehicleId so it will not be passed at item level. Only Vin will be passed at order header level. [~10672880] can you please confirm

[~30081459] is correct. Carvana will not have the AZVehicleID, only the VIN.

[~11155926], Carvana is different as is every punchout customer. Some send vehicle in header extrinsic, some do not. Our native format is to have it at the item level so we can accept an order that has multiple vehicle applications. Carvana will never do this.

[~10672880] Could you please confirm on this.
1. Carvana will have only one VIN at orderRequestHeader level. There will be no option for them to order parts for 2 different vehicles in single order.
2. Other users can send vehicles at item level and there will be able to send multiple vehicles with each of the vehicles has n number of parts

The new cXML is applicable only for CARVANA. Not for other users. [~11155926] Please confirm on this as well.

*Vehicle Repo:*
/dyn/admin/nucleus//atg/registry/ContentRepositories/VehicleRepository/

<query-items item-descriptor="vehicle" id-only="false">
pin = "100002" AND azVehicleId = "4081401"
</query-items>

<remove-item id="233000001-md2" item-descriptor="vehicle" />

comments.body: [~11155926] will add AC.

As per discussion with  [~10672880] [~10568198] 
 * There will be no non commerce items like labor/Misc/Manual items sent in cxml from carvana
 * store notes will be sent as part of commentType or commentText
 * vehicles needs to be derived from VIN sent in orderRequestHeader for all the Items. There will be no azVehicleId sent at item level
 * There will be no For Resale/Not For Resale option available and it has to be set by Default as For Resale (which is default value for normal punchout flow)

CC: [~11138670]

MR for the changes : [https://gitlab.autozone.com/commercial/b2b/azpro/-/merge_requests/4757]

Deals with extrinsic fields (deal applied)

What if we use the new cXML for others user (Like SONIC,EMORY)

E2E:
Place order and validate throughout returns process 
<< Single Non VDP, VDP, Split Order, Core Deferred, Core Charged, Deals>>

*Current flow:*
As soon as we do transfer cart, atg id shows PENDING_APPROVAL
After Payload submit, SUBMITTED
After invoice,PROCESSING
After trickle processing the request,INVOICED_BY_STORE
After processing invoice schedular, NO_PENDING_ACTION
After returning thru returns app, it stays in NO_PENDING_ACTION
After trickle processing returns record, status of return will be in "INVOICED"

*New Flow with hybrid cXML:*
As soon as we submit order through new cXML, the status shows PROCESSING (we can see PENDING_APPROVAL in logs)
After invoice, the status is still in PROCESSING
After trickle processing the request, INVOICED_BY_STORE
After processing invoice schedular, NO_PENDING_ACTION
After returning thru returns app, it stays in NO_PENDING_ACTION
After trickle processing returns record, status of return will be in "INVOICED"

fields.summary: Stocked Item badge - BE

comments.body:
*QE Questions:*
1. Are we going to display "Stocked Item" as soon as we have item is in stocking plan ie when item is added in COM_CUS_SLS_ITM? or when customer stocks in plan ie when the qty is even 0 in stocking web application?

Need business clarification on when to send this flag 

CC: [~10638319]

A stocked item badge will appear on the cart when an item that is apart of a customers stocking program is added. This badge is not a link. 

For pricing, if their stocking program pricing is better this will be the pricing that will be applied. If a deal is available and is better priced than the "deal applied" badge will also appear.
What is the field in cart response for that flag?

Hello [~11128924] , Here is the flag which can be used to have stocked badge.
stockedItem - true/false , if its true then consider the item as stocked item.
 
 

[~11138670]  - Here is the MR [https://gitlab.autozone.com/commercial/b2b/azpro/-/merge_requests/4620] , please review and merge the same.


!image-2024-04-02-13-12-10-592.png!
[~11159107] , Please validate this in qa1.

[~11165695] , [~11138670] , [~11222415] Below are the scenarios we are going to cover. Please review and let us know if we missed any.
 # Validate the stocked item flag as true, when the sku is eligible for stocking plan
 # Validate  the stocked item and Deal Eligible both flag as true, when the sku is eligible for stocking plan and overall deal is better - (Same Deal Qty, More than Deal Qty)
 # Validate the stocked item flag as true and Deal Eligible flag as false, when the sku is eligible for stocking plan and overall deal is better - (Less Deal qty)
 # Validate the stocked item flag as true and Deal Eligible flag as false, when the sku is eligible for stocking plan and overall Stocking is better - (Less Deal qty, Same Deal Qty, More than Deal Qty)
 # Validate the stocked item flag as false, when the sku is not eligible for stocking plan

dev need from UI/UX in order to start implementing:
 * error state - also need design for error messages, their alignment (left / right / center), max width, handling large messages, wrapping.
 * focused state
 * disabled state (buttons, input)
 * buttons borders - what areas will react to user clicks, just + and - or some area around it
 * input borders - what area will react to focus on input
 * handling large numbers - overflow: hiding, ellipsis, scroll etc. or increase width - then need max.width

fields.summary: Increase/Decrease QTY - Cart - V2

comments.body:
FE questions:
 # "{_}If user goes over an available item qty, we need to show an alternative state that there would be another available item"{_} - *what field from /cart API can FE use to show alternative part #?*
 # There is an input field the customer can type in directly, should the FE not accept values below 1, or show an error message that only positive values >0 are accepted?
 # Considering FE is sending API call to {{{}PATCH 'host{}}}/azpro/v1/orders/items' on every item update - we need to show successful / unsuccessful notifications. FE need texts for the messages.
 # What is "Swap out this item"? Is this a link or a button? If yes - what should happen on click?
!Screenshot 2024-02-15 at 4.23.30 PM.png|width=157,height=131!

Refer to numbers in the very first comment.
 # [~11155926] can you please clarify what should we do with alternative part #?
 # [~11222415] please update AC
 # [~11155926] please check what should be updated in {{{}PATCH 'host{}}}/azpro/v1/orders/items' endpoint to provide updated data like tax etc.

1. Moved to EOCO-1725

2. Complete

The QTY stepper is being updated to the following, please use this one throughout the Cart while UX updates the figma. 

!image-2024-02-15-13-48-31-489.png!

*QE Questions:*
1. Do we need to disable submit order if that particular part has reached maximum qty?
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
2. Can we click on the part from cart/checkout page and add qty?
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
3. Since the field is user defined one, are we going to restrict entering values other than numeric (0 to 9)?

[~30081459] 
 # Yes, customer can not submit an order if max qty has been reached and they see the error message
 # No, were removing the modal functionality from the new cart 
 # No, current functionality is a user can add a # > 9. We should not restrict them from doing so

Regarding point 3, we can add only numeric value (not any char or special character). We should be restricting those invalid values as that's how in current stage.

[~11222415] Can we please add these in AC's that submit order should be disabled, modal should not be accessible in new page?

[~11222415] we still need an answer for this one:
 * Considering FE is sending API call to {{{}PATCH 'host{}}}/azpro/v1/orders/items' on every item update - we need to show successful / unsuccessful notifications. FE need texts for the messages.

In addition to this we have new questions:
 * For updated stepper we also need "disabled" states (when the minus is inactive), "focused" and "error" state - the red bottom border. Also FE team to keep in mind the scope has increased by ~3 points as we don't have that stepper in starc - we'll have to implement from scratch. Also [~11222415] we need figma for stepper - at least standalone, as we can't get dimensions from the screenshot. Also we need to know the "input" area and "button" area.
 * Should the user be able to click + after max quantity reached?
 * Should the "swap or call for delivery estimate" message be hidden if the user clicks "-" after reaching max quantity?

[~11128924] - 
 * Is this what you mean by successful / unsuccessful notification? If so, we dont have this in production today when a user adds to the quantity to the cart, does this really need to be added? 

!image-2024-02-26-10-32-19-655.png!
 * UX has these states, they're working on putting a handover file together to implement in this ticket | EOCO-1803
 * Yes, we are not limiting the amount. Production today allows up too 999
 * If the max qty is 10, the message should be shown if they add 11 to the cart and the message should disappear if they click "-" and goes back to 10.

[~11222415] 
 * _*Is this what you mean by successful / unsuccessful notification? If so, we dont have this in production today when a user adds to the quantity to the cart, does this really need to be added?*_ - yes, exactly this kind of notification. Current production does not have that because on every quantity update the whole page is reloaded hence there is no chance that the quantity is updated on the front end but not updated on server - the server responds with the new page with updated quantities. The new implementation is front-end driven, customer updates quantity and the API endpoint is being called in the background. It's important to notify the user about successful/unsuccessful update because the API call might not go through, and the quantity can be not updated on server. We need at least show the unsuccessful notification to the user as per UX best practices.
 * *_If the max qty is 10, the message should be shown if they add 11 to the cart and the message should disappear if they click "-" and goes back to 10._* - what if user keeps clicking "+"? Should we go to 12, 13...? Or we should disable + button after reaching available quanitity?

# [~10638319] Please confirm you're aligned with point #1 
 # [~11128924] Yes were not going to limit the user from continuously clicking "+". We just need to ensure that the max qty message appears and the submit order button is disabled if they go past the available qty
